author: Yolanda R
title: Not quite the Waldorf, but getting there.
text:
As former Waldorf guests, we loved the beautiful Art Deco lobby.
The location is great and we were even able to check into our rooms early. Front desk employees were professional and knowledgeable, but looked a little less than that. One lady's name tag was upside down and the concierge was wearing plastic slides.... Our rooms were on the 3rd floor. They were "superior doubles" - looked like a regular double to me. No views, but the beds were comfortable and the one of the rooms was quiet. The heater/AC in our other room was rather loud. Bathrooms were smallish, but it is an old hotel. Towels and hairdryer were precariously located above the toilet - an accident waiting to happen! We were also a little befuddled about the $15 Wifi charge....I hear that there will be some remodeling going on later this year to upgrade the rooms and elevators. Free Wifi would be great.
